abstract: Ben S. Bernanke said a “fresh wave of investor concern” led to tougher credit conditions, reinforcing views that the Fed will cut interest rates at its next meeting.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said a “fresh wave of investor concern” led to tougher credit conditions, reinforcing views that the Fed will cut interest rates at its next meeting.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 — Ben S. Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve, acknowledged on Thursday that a “fresh wave of investor concern” had led to tougher credit conditions that posed new risks to the economy, reinforcing the view that the Fed is likely to cut interest rates again, when it meets on Dec. 11.

headline.main: Fed Chief Offers New Hint on a Rate Cut
headline.print_headline: Fed Chief Reinforces Suggestions of Rate Cut
